snippet.title: Free healthcare for asylum seekers in Qld
snippet.content: The Queensland government has reintroduced a policy to provide free health care to asylum seekers who are ineligible for Medicare. Health Minister Cameron Dick has reinstated a 2006 policy that was discontinued under the Newman government's hospital and health services reforms. "Estimates put it at a few hundred people, so the costs of providing them with access to care are quite modest compared with the health, social and community benefits to be gained," Mr Dick said. (C) AAP 2017
